page.title: 02TRADE- market
page.content: Since the Middle Ages, Stamford has had many markets, but now, in 1986, we only have two main ones-a cattle market (Monday) and a general market (Friday). The general market is held in Broad St. and Ironmonger St., and there are between 80 and 90 stalls. About 33% of it is clothing, whilst fruit and vegetables take up about 10%. Other stalls consist of fish, meat, hardware, dress / curtain materials, plants, bed linen/towels, toys, cards, knitting wool, jewellery, footwear, leather goods, charity stalls (eg Red Cross), cakes, cane crafts, general food, confectionery, petfoods, dairy produce and cosmetic Most stall holders visit other markets in East Anglia and the Midlands. Most of the interviewed stall holders rated the market a good one. Among suggestions were: more and cleaner
